name: Angelus
description:
Founded in 1891 in Switzerland, Angelus has been one of the most influential horological manufactures of the last century.
Watchmaking connoisseurs universally hailed Angelus' pioneering, in-house developed movements and timepieces, which continue to be coveted by collectors all over the world. Today’s Angelus is fully equipped to design, produce, finish, assemble, regulate and test all its movements and timepieces in-house. The Angelus collection blends the very best of vintage high watchmaking with contemporary design and materials.

name: Armin Strom
description:
When ‘Mr. Armin Strom’ retired from watchmaking, he transferred ownership of his brand to two boys (by then adults) who had had frequented his workshop so often together in childhood: businessperson Serge Michel and Master Watchmaker Claude Greisler.
In 2009, the revitalized Armin Strom built upon Mr. Strom’s historical legacy with the opening of its first fully-integrated Manufacture; located in Biel, Switzerland.
Today the Manufacture produces all of our timepieces in-house and with great reverence for the Swiss-German watchmaking tradition. Our extraordinary team of dedicated engineers and artisans, led by Master Watchmaker Claude Greisler, uphold that tradition with uncompromising passion and commitment.

name: Arnold & Son
description:
SWISS WATCHMAKING WITH ENGLISH ROOTS
Named after John Arnold, English watchmaker of the 18th century renowned for his ingenuity and work on marine chronometers, Arnold & Son perpetuates today his legacy, exploring contemporary ways to interpret traditional watch craftsmanship.
From its Manufacture based in La Chaux-de-Fonds, cradle of the Swiss watchmaking industry, Arnold & Son develops its timepieces in-house including its complicated calibres. The House established iconic collections such as the Time Pyramid with its unique architecture, the Nebula featuring a fully skeletonized movement, the HM Perpetual Moon displaying one of the biggest moon phases on the market or the Globetrotter, impressive three-dimensional worldtimer.

name: Ball
description: Today, BALL Watch is one of the most respected and established watch brands in the United States. We continue to update the product range in the 21st century to keep pace with shifting consumer patterns. But, despite changes in appearance, the founding spirit of the brand - industrial function - is never compromised. It is upheld in Ball's original details, such as the watch dial that faithfully follows his design guidelines for the standard railway watch. Every detail, from the shape of the hands to the style of the numerals, was laid down by the founder in his quest for accuracy in timekeeping. It is a vision that the Ball family remains faithful to. For legions of men and women today whose split-second decisions keep the world ticking, it is a shared commitment.

name: Breguet
description: Breguet evokes a genuine fascination through its capacity for innovation. Its inventions have left an indelible imprint on watchmaking history and the developments currently being achieved within the Manufacture make Breguet an undeniable reference in its field.

name: Bremont
description: BREMONT IS AN AWARD-WINNING BRITISH COMPANY PRODUCING BEAUTIFULLY ENGINEERED CHRONOMETERS AT OUR HEADQUARTERS IN HENLEY ON THAMES, ENGLAND.

name: Bulgari
description:
Bulgari is committed to conducting its business in a socially responsible manner, a commitment that also extends beyond the confines of the company as well as to the promotion of ethical standards and socially responsible management practices throughout its entire supply chain.
Bulgari promotes environmental and social responsibility of suppliers and works with them to ensure best-in-class social and environmental standards. Bvlgari promotes values and principles to be applied to its supply chain through the LVMH Supplier Code of Conduct and Bulgari Annex on Mineral Supply Chains launched in 2022.

name: Carl F. Bucherer
description: Self-confidence is an essential precondition for becoming established as an entrepreneur. Carl Friedrich Bucherer’s self-confidence was based on creativity, technical skills, prudence and a steadfast adherence to his goals. Since its formation more than 135 years ago, the company formed by this visionary figure has remained in the sole ownership of the Bucherer family. Continuity, a free spirit and entrepreneurial independence are thus hallmarks of our brand, as is the dynamism that has again and again put us decisively ahead of time.

name: Cartier
description: At Cartier, everything begins with the design. The Maison’s obsession for pure lines, precise shapes and precious details has led to design objects that defy the decades. Uncover the watch collections that have become emblems of design at Cartier: Tank, Santos, Panthère, Ballon Bleu and many more.

name: Chanel
description: Chanel is a renowned French luxury fashion brand known for its elegant clothing, accessories, and fragrances. They also have a line of luxury watches that reflect the brand's style and craftsmanship. Chanel watches are highly regarded for their quality materials and attention to detail.

name: Chopard
description: Renowned for its creativity, state-of-the-art technology and the virtuosity of its artisans, Chopard has become one of the leading names in the luxury Swiss watch and jewellery industry. Discover its spectacular journey under the impetus of the Scheufele family, from 1860 to the present day.

name: Christophe Claret
description:
Since 1989, Christophe Claret has worked surrounded by the Neuchâtel mountains, where the heart of Swiss watchmaking beats strongest; where all the skills that combine to create an exceptional timepiece can be found.
Christophe Claret's workshops are in Le Locle, at Le Soleil d'Or, a magnificent manor house which has been transformed to receive highly qualified staff and state-of-the-art machines. This ranks him among the rare few companies with the ability to design, develop and produce a fine watch from the first to the last component.
A timepiece by the Christophe Claret brand is a collective endeavour, brought to life through the force of passion, perseverance and, beneath it all, emotion. Thus the brand creates supremely complex and highly innovative watches that admirers of rare objects aspire to own. The company looks beyond what has already been done. It embraces innovative technology, as much in its products as its means of production. It takes the impossible into the realm of the possible, never afraid to think outside the box to propose new ways to display the time.
Christophe Claret takes the best of tradition to invent his own watchmaking future.

name: De Bethune
description: De Bethune is an independent Swiss watch manufacturer located at L’Auberson, in the Jura mountain pastures of the canton of Vaud, Switzerland. Here, some 50 employees, including watchmakers, engineers, developer-designers, micromechanical engineers, polishers and decorators focus firmly on the research and development of technical and aesthetic innovations in the spirit of the great 18th century master watchmakers.

name: Devon
description: For the watch enthusiast with a passion for innovation and ingenuity, the new must-have timepieces are from DEVON. These engineering masterpieces are from our design lab  that has dedicated itself to creating innovative luxury products that exemplify the American spirit that immediately establishes a leading-edge vision and an exquisite command of the artistry of watch design.  Our unique functionality reinvents the watch, extending far beyond the boundaries of traditional watchmaking.  DEVON'S movement  is a mesmerizing display of our patented system of interwoven Time Belts that displays hours, minutes and seconds in a way that’s never been dreamed of before.

name: F.P. Journe
description:
For over thirty years,François-Paul Journe explored all the aspects of ancient horology. Through the restoration of one of a kind historical pieces, he revisits the intellectual and cultural path of clock and watchmakers who have imprinted the history of horological science. He is fascinated by the XVIII th century which remains the golden age of time measurement.
The exclusive for a broader public:
Each of the unique pieces François-Paul Journe was creating was the result of countless hours of research, that he saw disappearing when the commissioner took up his watch. He then began dreaming about a collection of high horology watches offering the same qualities - comfort, innovations and performances - but for a wider public!

name: Franck Muller
description: Franck Muller watches are one of the finest and most complicated of the world. The manufacture was founded in Geneva by Franck Muller and Vartan Sirmakes with the aim of creating exclusive timepieces characterised by complicated movements and original designs. Thanks to its strong in-house capabilities in numerous fields of Haute Horlogerie, this young company rapidly became one of the best Swiss horlogerie brands. Today, we believe we succeeded in combining boldness and creativity with exceptional Haute Horlogerie know-how.

name: Girard Perregaux
description: For over two centuries, our watches have marked far more than time. They reflect our ability to bridge between the past and future. Between technical mastery and iconic design. Between functionality and aesthetics. Our name itself is born from a union, the marriage between Constant Girard and Marie Perregaux in 1854.

name: Glashutte Original
description: Glashütte Original stands for innovative watchmaking art that meets the highest standards. Our timepieces are the product of the best in German engineering and craftsmanship: technically sophisticated, reliably precise and timelessly beautiful. Clearly defined values play a major role – they give us motivation day after day.

locale_name.jp: グラスヒュッテ・オリジナル

name: Graham
description: Located in the heart of Swiss Watchmaking in La Chaux-de-Fonds, Graham is one of the rare watch brands holding a long and rich historical background. Graham brand name was created by renown watchmaker late Georges Graham in 1695 in London. Graham brand shined over 100 year to disappear from the scene for a long time.

name: Greubel Forsey
description:
It was the end of a century, even the end of a millennium. Two entrepreneurs who had trodden unconventional paths decided to combine their talents. They envisioned an extreme, uncompromising approach to fine watchmaking that would reimagine, one by one, each of the technical and aesthetic fundamentals established over the previous 200 years.
Robert & Stephen would soon become Greubel Forsey. The two watchmakers set their sights directly on the heart of the watch: the escapement. Their first developments were realised by using Meccano!

locale_name.jp: グルーベル フォルセイ

name: H. Moser & Cie.
description: This spirit of entrepreneurship has always been at the core of H. Moser & Cie. as the brand pursued its development under the leadership of a few entrepreneurs through the 19 th , 20 th and today at the start of the 21 st century it continues to be its driving force. Rather than simply recreating the past and following the mainstream, we strive to create our own future, just as Heinrich Moser did so many generations ago. And while our founder may not be here to guide us today, Heinrich Moser’s descendants play an active role at H. Moser & Cie. and continue to uphold his legacy.

name: Alpina
description:
Our mission is now and has always been to manufacture extremely reliable professional sports watches, respecting and implementing the “Alpinist Principle” in manufacturing, design and technological innovation. Our work is deeply inspired by the legacy of our visionary founder, Gottlieb Hauser.
We are committed to producing extremely robust sport watches that perform to the highest precision and with the greatest reliability in the most demanding situations. Alpina manufactures watches specifically engineered and built to withstand extreme natural environments, especially at high altitudes and great depths. Their functions, materials and usability are purposely designed to ensure that you accomplish your climbing, flying, diving or sailing missions.

name: Baume & Mercier
description: Baume & Mercier has shown a tendency to engage in collaboration since William Baume met Paul Mercier in 1912. Today, more than ever, Baume & Mercier intends on asserting its concept of watchmaking: its openness to other realms and the world in general; its way of keeping up with the times, in real time; and its refusal to compromise the attention brought to developing creativity within the House. In a collective, collabora-tive, responsible approach, the Brand launches projects where watchmaking resonates with artistic crea-tivity. This leads to concerted considerations of today’s design challenges, necessarily taking environmen-tal issues into account; the combination of different experiences and types of expertise; and the explora-tion of new possibilities and innovations.

name: Bell & Ross
description:
Bell & Ross watches meet four basic principles: legibility, functionality, reliability and precision.
Thus, every detail has its purpose, its function. This technical precision is expressed through pure lines and timeless elegance.

name: Blancpain
description: Blancpain is proud of its history dating back to 1735, making it the world's oldest watch brand. Over the centuries since its foundation, the Maison has maintained its commitment to innovate and has constantly pushed the limits of watchmaking. At Blancpain, the expression 'Innovation is our tradition' is a fundamental guiding principle.

name: Bovet
description:
Bovet is a Swiss luxury watchmaking company that is known for its high-end and intricately designed timepieces. The company was founded in 1822 by Edouard Bovet, and it has a rich history of producing exquisite watches that combine exceptional craftsmanship, artistic detailing, and innovative mechanical features.
Bovet watches are often recognized for their unique design elements, including elaborate hand-painted dials, intricate engravings, and distinctive case shapes. The brand is also known for its use of transparent case backs, allowing wearers to admire the intricate movement and mechanisms inside the watch.

name: Citizen
description:
Citizen, a trusted name and brand leader in the watch industry for over 100 years, is known the world over for its uncompromising values: technical precision, innovative mindset, quality craftsmanship and design excellence. The first to create quartz crystal and titanium timepieces, Citizen was also an early pioneer in advocating for the environment, launching the first light-powered watches with proprietary Eco-Drive technology in 1976, thus adding eco-mindful as a core value.
Grounded in the Japanese notion that elevates society above self, Citizen takes a forward-thinking, socially responsible and inclusive world view: creating quality timepieces at superior value for all citizens of the world to enjoy every minute of their time. And our deep-rooted respect for self-development guides our corporate philosophy: Better Starts Now. Whether it’s creating a better product, a better customer experience, a better planet, Citizen embraces opportunity and growth.

name: Cvstos
description: Cvstos was launched in 2005 as a vibrantly bold venture in watchmaking. Today, the brand’s identity in the elite world of Haute Horlogerie is more striking than ever. The presentation of several major innovations demonstrates the undaunted willpower of Cvstos and defines it as a byword for innovative design and superb craftmanship.

name: Daniel Roth
description: ESTABLISHED IN 1988 BY THE TALENTED WATCHMAKER OF THE SAME NAME, DANIEL ROTH IS A PIONEER OF INDEPENDENT WATCHMAKING. IT ILLUMINATED THE PATH FOR FUTURE GENERATIONS OF WATCHMAKERS BY PROMOTING HIGH COMPLICATIONS AND TRADITIONAL CRAFTSMANSHIP.

name: Ebel
description: EBEL watches have been highly regarded for their combination of classic design, Swiss craftsmanship, and attention to detail. The brand has a rich history in watchmaking and has produced a variety of collections that appeal to different tastes and preferences. From dress watches to sporty models, EBEL has maintained a reputation for producing high-quality timepieces.

name: Frederique Constant
description: Frederique Constant is a Swiss luxury watch manufacturer known for producing high-quality timepieces with classic designs and precision craftsmanship. The company was founded in 1988 by Aletta Bax and Peter Stas and has since gained recognition for its dedication to creating elegant watches at affordable prices compared to other Swiss luxury brands.

name: Gucci
description: Gucci is a well-known luxury fashion brand that offers a wide range of products, including clothing, accessories, and watches. Gucci watches are highly regarded for their stylish design, quality craftsmanship, and the brand's iconic motifs.

name: Hamilton
description:
Hamilton is a Swiss watch brand with a rich history dating back to 1892. Originally founded in Lancaster, Pennsylvania, USA, the brand is known for its combination of American spirit and Swiss precision. Hamilton watches have gained popularity for their quality craftsmanship, distinctive designs, and strong ties to both aviation and Hollywood.
Over the years, Hamilton has produced a wide range of watch styles, including dress watches, sports watches, and aviation-inspired timepieces.

name: Harry Winston
description: Harry Winston is a renowned luxury brand known for its exquisite jewelry and timepieces. Harry Winston watches are highly regarded for their exceptional craftsmanship, innovation, and elegance. The brand was founded by Harry Winston himself in New York City in 1932.

name: Hermes
description:
Hermès is a renowned French luxury brand known for its high-end fashion, accessories, and lifestyle products. While the brand is more commonly associated with items like clothing, leather goods, and perfumes, it also produces a range of luxury watches.
Hermès watches are known for their exquisite craftsmanship, elegant design, and attention to detail. They often feature premium materials, including high-quality metals and leather straps. Hermès watches are designed to embody the brand's sense of luxury and sophistication, catering to individuals who appreciate fine aesthetics and craftsmanship.

name: Hublot
description: Hublot is a Swiss luxury watchmaker founded in 1980 by Italian entrepreneur Carlo Crocco. The brand quickly gained recognition for its innovative designs and the fusion of traditional Swiss watchmaking with modern and unconventional materials.

name: HYT
description:
HYT is a Swiss luxury watch brand known for its innovative and unconventional timepieces. The name 'HYT' stands for 'Hydro Technology,' which refers to their unique approach of using fluids to indicate time.
Traditional watches use mechanical movements or electronic displays to show the time, but HYT watches use a patented fluidic module to display hours using a liquid-filled capillary tube. This liquid moves gradually as time passes, allowing the user to read the time based on the position of the liquid within the tube. The minutes are typically displayed through a more conventional sub-dial.
The fluid used in HYT watches is specially formulated to be immune to temperature changes and is driven by a mechanical movement. This combination of fluid mechanics and watchmaking expertise results in a visually striking and mechanically complex timepiece.
HYT watches are known for their avant-garde designs and limited-edition models. They appeal to watch enthusiasts who are interested in unconventional horological concepts and cutting-edge design. Keep in mind that my knowledge is based on information available up until September 2021, so there may have been developments or new releases in the HYT watch lineup since then.

name: IWC
description: IWC Schaffhausen, often referred to simply as IWC, is a Swiss luxury watch manufacturer based in Schaffhausen, Switzerland. The company was founded in 1868 by an American engineer and watchmaker, Florentine Ariosto Jones, with the goal of combining Swiss craftsmanship with modern American manufacturing techniques. IWC is known for producing high-quality mechanical watches that combine technical innovation, precision engineering, and elegant design.

name: Jacob & Co.
description: Jacob & Co. is a luxury watch and jewelry brand known for its extravagant and innovative timepieces. The company was founded in 1986 by Jacob Arabo in New York City. While they produce a wide range of jewelry and accessories, they gained significant attention for their highly complex and visually striking watches.

name: Jaeger-LeCoultre
description:
Jaeger-LeCoultre is a Swiss luxury watch manufacturer that has been in operation since 1833. The company is known for its high-quality, innovative, and intricate timepieces. Over the years, Jaeger-LeCoultre has earned a reputation for producing both classic and avant-garde watches, often incorporating complex complications and artistic designs.
One of the notable features of Jaeger-LeCoultre watches is their in-house movement manufacturing. The company is renowned for its expertise in creating and producing a wide range of movements, including some of the most intricate and sophisticated complications in the watchmaking industry. This vertical integration and mastery of movement development set Jaeger-LeCoultre apart in the world of watchmaking.

name: Jaquet Droz
description:
Jaquet Droz is a Swiss luxury watchmaker that was founded by Pierre Jaquet-Droz in 1738. The brand is known for its exquisite craftsmanship, artistic design, and intricate mechanical movements. Jaquet Droz watches are often recognized for their elegant and classic aesthetic, combining traditional watchmaking techniques with creative and artistic elements.
One of the most notable aspects of Jaquet Droz watches is their use of 'automata,' which are intricate mechanical devices that mimic human or animal movements. Pierre Jaquet-Droz himself was a skilled watchmaker and automaton creator, and his creations were highly sought after by European royalty and aristocracy.
The brand's watch collections often feature unique and imaginative designs, incorporating elements such as grand feu enamel dials, hand-painted miniature scenes, and complex complications. Many of their pieces are also characterized by clean lines, minimalistic aesthetics, and a focus on displaying the intricate movements.
Jaquet Droz watches are typically considered to be high-end luxury timepieces and are often collected by enthusiasts and connoisseurs of horology (the study and art of timekeeping). The brand continues to create limited-edition and one-of-a-kind pieces that combine traditional craftsmanship with innovative designs, making them highly sought after in the world of haute horlogerie.

name: Jean Richard
description:
Jean Richard is a Swiss watchmaking company known for producing luxury watches. The brand was originally founded in 1681 by Daniel Jeanrichard, a skilled watchmaker from the Swiss Jura region. However, it gained more prominence in the modern era when it was revitalized by a different Swiss watch company, Girard-Perregaux, in the late 20th century.
Jean Richard watches often feature high-quality craftsmanship, intricate designs, and precise movements. They are considered luxury timepieces and can be quite sought after by watch enthusiasts and collectors. The brand is known for its dedication to watchmaking traditions and its commitment to producing watches that combine innovation and elegance.

name: Kari Voutilainen
description:
Kari Voutilainen is a renowned Finnish watchmaker known for creating exquisite and high-quality mechanical watches. He established his own watchmaking brand in 2002 and quickly gained a reputation for his exceptional craftsmanship and attention to detail. Voutilainen's watches are highly sought after by collectors and enthusiasts due to their limited production and exceptional artistry.
Voutilainen's timepieces often feature traditional watchmaking techniques combined with innovative design elements. He is known for his hand-finishing of movements, intricate dials, and unique artistic touches. His watches often incorporate complications such as tourbillons, perpetual calendars, and minute repeaters.
The watches produced by Kari Voutilainen are considered works of art in the watchmaking world, and they often command high prices due to their exclusivity and the amount of labor that goes into creating them. If you're interested in owning a Kari Voutilainen watch, it's recommended to reach out to authorized dealers or directly to the brand to inquire about availability and pricing, as these watches are usually made in limited quantities and can be challenging to obtain.

name: Laurent Ferrier
description:
Laurent Ferrier is a Swiss luxury watch brand known for its high-end, traditional, and elegant timepieces. The brand is named after its founder, Laurent Ferrier, who comes from a family with a strong watchmaking heritage. Laurent Ferrier has worked for prestigious watch brands like Patek Philippe, where he gained extensive experience and knowledge in horology.
Laurent Ferrier watches are highly regarded in the watchmaking community for their exceptional craftsmanship, attention to detail, and classic designs. The brand focuses on creating watches that pay homage to traditional watchmaking techniques while incorporating modern innovations.

name: Longines
description: Longines is a Swiss luxury watchmaker that has been producing high-quality timepieces since its founding in 1832. The company is known for its elegance, tradition, and precision in watchmaking. Longines has a rich history and has contributed to various developments in the watch industry over the years.

name: Louis Moinet
description:
Louis Moinet is a Swiss luxury watch brand known for its high-quality and innovative timepieces. The brand is named after Louis Moinet, a 19th-century French watchmaker and inventor who is often credited with inventing the chronograph, a complication that allows for the measurement of time intervals.
Louis Moinet watches are known for their intricate designs, fine craftsmanship, and incorporation of rare materials and unique complications. The brand focuses on creating limited-edition and bespoke watches that cater to collectors and enthusiasts who appreciate both horological innovation and artistic design.

name: Maurice Lacroix
description:
Maurice Lacroix is a Swiss luxury watch brand that was founded in 1975. The company is known for producing high-quality timepieces that blend traditional Swiss watchmaking craftsmanship with modern design elements. Maurice Lacroix watches are often praised for their attention to detail, precision, and overall aesthetic appeal.
The brand offers a wide range of watch collections for both men and women, catering to various styles and preferences.

name: Maximilian Busser & Friends
description:
Maximilian Büsser & Friends, often abbreviated as MB&F, is a Swiss luxury watch brand known for its innovative and artistic approach to watchmaking. Founded by Maximilian Büsser in 2005, the brand has gained a reputation for creating unconventional and imaginative timepieces that challenge traditional watch design norms.
Instead of adhering to a traditional corporate structure, MB&F operates on a unique collaborative model where various 'friends' or independent artisans, designers, and watchmakers contribute to the creation of their timepieces. This approach has led to the production of some highly intricate and visually striking watches that often resemble miniature sculptures or mechanical art pieces.
MB&F's creations often incorporate high levels of complexity, innovative materials, and imaginative designs. They have produced watches inspired by science fiction, space exploration, and even aquatic life. Each watch is limited in production, making them highly collectible and sought after by watch enthusiasts and collectors.

name: Meistersinger
description: Like the very first mechanical clocks, MeisterSinger watches display the time with just one single hand, literally summing up the entire experience by pointing to that one precious moment and thus conveying a reassuring sense of time. Superb design and outstanding Swiss watchmaking precision are combined to create watches that won’t go out of style and may well be an inspiration for generations to come.

name: Montblanc
description:
From the beginning stages of assembling individual parts to presenting a truly alive and resplendent piece, our products are lifestyle companions that will accompany yours and future generations to come.
Be it writing instruments, leather, watches, accessories or our youngest category of new technologies, our master craftsmen work diligently to pour their hearts and souls into every step of the creation.
The international mentality of our 3 pioneering founders of the maison continues to be a strong legacy of the brand to this day. Our writing instruments are completed in Hamburg, our leather goods in Florence and our timepieces in Switzerland.

name: Moritz Grossmann
description:
Moritz Grossmann is a German luxury watch brand that specializes in creating high-quality mechanical watches. The brand is named after its founder, Moritz Grossmann, who was a pioneering watchmaker in the 19th century and played a significant role in the development of watchmaking in Glashütte, Germany.
The modern Moritz Grossmann watch company was revived in 2008 with the goal of continuing the tradition of fine German watchmaking. The company produces limited quantities of handcrafted watches that emphasize traditional craftsmanship, precision, and innovative design. Moritz Grossmann watches are known for their attention to detail, intricate movements, and dedication to maintaining the heritage of Glashütte watchmaking.

locale_name.ja: モリッツ・グロスマン

name: Movado
description:
Movado is a Swiss watch brand known for its distinctive and minimalist designs. The company was founded in 1881 in La Chaux-de-Fonds, Switzerland. Movado is recognized for its iconic Museum Watch, which features a single dot at 12 o'clock to symbolize the sun at high noon.
Movado watches are often characterized by their sleek and modern aesthetics, often favoring clean lines and a single dot or minimalist markers on the dial. The brand has a history of collaborating with renowned artists and designers to create unique timepieces.
Movado Group, Inc., which includes brands like Movado, Ebel, Concord, and more, is a prominent player in the watch industry, offering a range of styles and price points.

name: Nomos Glashutte
description:
Nomos Glashütte is a German watchmaking company known for producing high-quality mechanical watches. The company is based in the town of Glashütte, which is renowned for its watchmaking heritage and is located in the Saxony region of Germany. Nomos Glashütte was founded in 1990, shortly after the reunification of Germany, and it has gained a reputation for its minimalist and contemporary designs.
Nomos watches are characterized by their clean and Bauhaus-inspired aesthetics, with an emphasis on legibility and functionality. The company is known for its in-house manufacturing, as it produces many of its components, including movements, in its own workshops. This level of vertical integration allows Nomos to maintain a high degree of quality control and craftsmanship.
One of the distinctive features of Nomos watches is the use of manual-winding and automatic movements that are often designed and produced in-house. These movements are known for their precision and reliability, and they often feature a characteristic three-quarter plate design, which is a nod to traditional German watchmaking techniques.

name: Omega
description:
Omega is a prestigious Swiss watchmaking brand that has a long history of producing high-quality and innovative timepieces. Founded in 1848 by Louis Brandt, the company has played a significant role in the development of the Swiss watch industry and has become one of the most recognizable and respected luxury watch brands in the world.
Omega has a strong reputation for innovation and accuracy in watchmaking. The brand has been involved in numerous advancements in timekeeping technology, including the development of the co-axial escapement, which is designed to reduce friction and improve the overall performance of the movement.
Omega continues to be a prominent player in the luxury watch industry, offering a wide range of models that cater to different tastes and preferences. The brand's commitment to innovation, craftsmanship, and historical significance has contributed to its enduring popularity among collectors and enthusiasts.

name: Oris
description:
Oris is a Swiss watch brand known for its focus on producing high-quality timepieces that offer a combination of value, craftsmanship, and unique designs. The company was founded in 1904 by Paul Cattin and Georges Christian in Hölstein, Switzerland. Oris has a reputation for creating watches that often have a distinct sporty or aviation-inspired aesthetic.
Oris is constantly striving to make better watches that offer beautiful, innovative functions and advanced performance levels. For example, the in-house developed Calibre 400 Series of Swiss Made automatics promises a five-day power reserve, anti-magnetism and a 10-year warranty and 10-year recommended service intervals.

name: Panerai
description:
Officine Panerai, commonly known as Panerai, is a luxury Italian watchmaker with a strong historical connection to the Italian Navy. The brand is known for its distinctive and bold designs, as well as its association with precision timekeeping and underwater activities.
Panerai was founded in 1860 in Florence, Italy. Initially, the brand was primarily known for producing precision instruments, including compasses and depth gauges, for the Italian Navy. Panerai's watches gained significant attention when they were adopted by naval divers and commandos due to their legibility and water-resistant properties.
Panerai is often recognized for its two iconic watch case designs: Luminor and Radiomir. The Luminor case is characterized by its distinctive crown protector, which helps enhance water resistance. The Radiomir case, on the other hand, is known for its cushion-shaped case and wire lugs. Both designs have become synonymous with the brand's identity.
Panerai's watches are known for their bold and instantly recognizable designs that pay homage to the brand's historical roots. The combination of Italian design sensibilities with Swiss watchmaking expertise has contributed to Panerai's enduring appeal in the luxury watch industry.

countries.name: Congo, The Democratic Republic of the
Macedonia, The Former Yugoslav Republic of
Saint Helena, Ascension and Tristan Da Cunha
South Georgia and the South Sandwich Islands

name: Parmigiani Fleurier
description:
Parmigiani Fleurier is a Swiss luxury watchmaking brand. The company was founded in 1996 by Michel Parmigiani in Fleurier, Switzerland. The name 'Fleurier' in the brand's name refers to the town in Switzerland where the brand's headquarters and manufacturing facilities are located.
Parmigiani Fleurier is known for its high-end, meticulously crafted watches that often feature intricate movements and exceptional craftsmanship. The brand has gained recognition for both its technical innovation and artistic design, and it has developed a reputation for producing highly exclusive and limited-edition timepieces.

locale_name.jp: パルミジャーニ・フルリエ

name: Patek Philippe
description:
Patek Philippe is a renowned Swiss luxury watch manufacturer that was founded in 1839. The company is based in Geneva, Switzerland. Patek Philippe is known for its exceptional craftsmanship, high-quality materials, and intricate movements. The brand has a long history of producing some of the world's most exquisite and sought-after timepieces, often considered as works of art as well as functional watches.
Patek Philippe is known for its tradition of innovation and has contributed significantly to the advancement of watchmaking technology. The brand has created numerous iconic and complicated watches, including perpetual calendars, minute repeaters, and tourbillons.
Patek Philippe watches are highly regarded for their quality, heritage, and exclusivity. The brand has a reputation for producing limited quantities of watches and maintaining a high level of demand among collectors and enthusiasts. Patek Philippe's commitment to excellence and its rich history have solidified its position as one of the most prestigious and respected watchmakers in the world.

locale_name.jp: パテック フィリップ

name: Perrelet
description:
Perrelet is a Swiss watchmaking company that was founded in 1777 by Abraham-Louis Perrelet. The brand is known for its contributions to horological history, particularly for being credited with inventing the automatic self-winding mechanism for watches. Perrelet's innovative design featured a rotor that wound the watch's mainspring with the movement of the wearer's wrist.
Perrelet's legacy is deeply rooted in its history of watchmaking innovation, and the brand continues to produce timepieces that incorporate both traditional craftsmanship and modern technology. The company offers a range of watches, including both classic and contemporary designs, often characterized by their unique dial layouts and rotor designs.
In recent years, Perrelet has gained recognition for its emphasis on skeletonized dials, showcasing the intricate inner workings of their movements. The brand's dedication to blending tradition with innovation has led to the creation of watches that appeal to collectors who appreciate both horological heritage and modern aesthetics.

name: Piaget
description:
Piaget is a Swiss luxury watch and jewelry brand known for its exquisite craftsmanship, elegant designs, and high-quality materials. The company was founded in 1874 by Georges Piaget in La Côte-aux-Fées, Switzerland. Piaget has gained a reputation for its expertise in ultra-thin movements and luxurious jewelry pieces.
Here are some key points about Piaget:
Luxury Watches: Piaget is famous for its luxury watches, which are often characterized by their sleek and sophisticated designs. The brand is known for producing both men's and women's watches with a focus on elegance and fine details.
Ultra-Thin Movements: Piaget has a history of creating ultra-thin watch movements, which require exceptional skill and precision to manufacture. These movements have set records for their slim profiles and technical prowess.
Jewelry and High Jewelry: In addition to watches, Piaget is renowned for its jewelry creations. The brand produces a wide range of jewelry pieces, from classic designs to high jewelry pieces featuring exquisite gemstones and craftsmanship.
In-House Movements: Piaget is known for its in-house movement production, demonstrating its commitment to watchmaking expertise. Many of its watches feature movements manufactured by the brand itself.
Piaget Polo: The Piaget Polo is one of the brand's iconic watch collections. It is characterized by its distinctive bracelet design and sporty yet elegant style.
Piaget Altiplano: The Altiplano collection is known for its ultra-thin watches, showcasing Piaget's expertise in crafting slim timepieces that retain precision and functionality.
Celebrity Endorsement: Piaget's luxury watches and jewelry have been favored by numerous celebrities and public figures over the years, contributing to the brand's status in the luxury market.
Piaget's combination of Swiss watchmaking heritage, artistic creativity, and innovation has cemented its position as a highly respected luxury brand. It continues to create timepieces and jewelry pieces that appeal to those who appreciate fine craftsmanship and timeless elegance.

name: Porsche Design
description:
Porsche Design is a luxury lifestyle brand that originated in Germany, known for its innovative and high-quality products. It was founded by Professor Ferdinand Alexander Porsche, the designer of the original Porsche 911 car. The brand was established in 1972 and has since gained recognition for its unique designs and collaborations across various industries.
Porsche Design offers a wide range of products, including watches, eyewear, fashion, accessories, electronics, and more. Here are some key aspects of Porsche Design:
Innovation and Aesthetics: Porsche Design is renowned for its commitment to both functional innovation and sleek, minimalist aesthetics. The brand often seeks to combine form and function to create products that are not only visually appealing but also practical and well-engineered.
Collaborations: Porsche Design has collaborated with various brands and companies to create special editions and unique products. These collaborations often merge Porsche Design's design philosophy with the expertise of partners in different industries.
Watches: Porsche Design produces a range of watches known for their precision and sophisticated design. The brand's timepieces often reflect the brand's automotive heritage and engineering principles.
Eyewear: Porsche Design eyewear is known for its contemporary and timeless designs. The eyewear collection includes sunglasses and prescription glasses that embody the brand's aesthetic.
Fashion and Accessories: The brand offers a collection of fashion items, leather goods, luggage, and accessories that share Porsche Design's design sensibilities.
Porsche Studio: Porsche Design often establishes flagship stores known as 'Porsche Studios.' These spaces showcase a curated selection of Porsche Design products and offer a unique brand experience.
Motorsport Influence: The brand's origins are tied to the world of motorsports, and this influence is reflected in its products' design and performance-oriented ethos.
While Porsche Design is associated with its German heritage, its products are available and appreciated internationally. The brand's commitment to quality, innovation, and design has led to a strong global presence.

name: Rado
description:
Rado is a Swiss watchmaking company that is known for its innovative designs and use of high-tech materials. The brand was founded in 1917 in Lengnau, Switzerland, by brothers Fritz, Ernst, and Werner Schlup. Rado has gained a reputation for its distinctive timepieces that often incorporate ceramics, sapphire crystal, and other cutting-edge materials.
Key features of Rado watches include:
High-Tech Materials: Rado is known for its pioneering use of materials like ceramic, sapphire crystal, and high-tech ceramics in watchmaking. These materials enhance the durability, scratch resistance, and unique aesthetic of Rado watches.
Ceramic Timepieces: Rado is particularly celebrated for its ceramic watches. The brand introduced the world's first scratch-resistant watch, the Rado DiaStar, in 1962. Since then, ceramics have become a signature element of many Rado watch designs.
Minimalist and Modern Designs: Rado watches often feature sleek and minimalist designs with a focus on clean lines and modern aesthetics.
Collaborations and Limited Editions: Rado has collaborated with designers and artists to create special edition watches that showcase unique design concepts.
Diverse Collections: Rado offers a wide range of collections, from classic to contemporary, catering to various tastes and styles.
Swiss Craftsmanship: While Rado is known for its innovative use of materials, the brand maintains a strong connection to traditional Swiss watchmaking craftsmanship.
Rado's innovative approach to watchmaking and its use of unconventional materials have set it apart in the luxury watch market. The brand's commitment to combining cutting-edge technology with elegant design has resulted in watches that appeal to those seeking modernity and innovation in their timepieces.

name: Ralph Christian
description:
Founded in London, in 2004 we decided to create a watch brand that catered to those who wanted to be in control of their time and take charge of their progression through life.
WE ARE OBSESSIVE ABOUT WATCH DESIGN
Unlike other brands that mass produce their watches and focus on quantity and cost - we focus on quality. We wanted to create a range of luxurious watches that you'd be proud to gift your brother, father, son - or yourself!
We set out with a simple goal when starting this venture - that our timepieces should accentuate the values of our wearers and provide an uncompromising and distinguished look that doesn't break the bank.
As we've said before: we focus on quality over quantity. This is why we only produce our watches in small batches. Sure, we could save money on big production runs but we would lose the ability to have hands-on control throughout the entire process. We only use high quality materials in our watches and and we believe producing in small numbers allows us to ensure the Ralph Christian standard lives up to your expectations from our hands, to yours.

name: Raymond Weil
description:
Raymond Weil is a Swiss luxury watchmaker known for its elegant and classical designs. The company was founded in 1976 by Raymond Weil in Geneva, Switzerland. The brand is characterized by its focus on creating timepieces that blend traditional Swiss watchmaking craftsmanship with a sense of modern style.
Here are some key points about Raymond Weil:
Family-Owned: Raymond Weil is one of the few remaining family-owned and operated Swiss watch brands. The company's independence allows it to maintain a strong connection to its heritage and values.
Classical Aesthetics: Raymond Weil watches are often recognized for their timeless and classical designs. The brand emphasizes understated elegance and sophistication in its timepieces.
Musical Influences: Many of Raymond Weil's watch collections are named after famous musical works or figures, reflecting the founder's passion for music. The brand has a close association with the world of music and often sponsors music-related events.
Variety of Collections: The brand offers a wide range of watch collections, catering to various styles and preferences. These collections include both men's and women's watches.
Swiss Craftsmanship: Raymond Weil maintains a commitment to Swiss watchmaking traditions, incorporating high-quality materials and precise movements into its timepieces.
Limited Editions: The brand frequently releases limited edition watches that pay tribute to notable individuals, events, or musical themes.
Accessible Luxury: Raymond Weil is often associated with accessible luxury, offering well-crafted Swiss watches at relatively affordable price points compared to some other luxury brands.
Raymond Weil's approach to watchmaking focuses on creating watches that resonate with individuals seeking classic designs, quality craftsmanship, and a touch of elegance. The brand's strong connection to music and its dedication to family values have contributed to its reputation in the luxury watch industry.

name: Richard Mille
description:
Richard Mille is a luxury Swiss watch brand known for its avant-garde designs, technical innovation, and high-performance timepieces. The company was founded in 2001 by French businessman Richard Mille in collaboration with Audemars Piguet. Richard Mille watches are recognized for their exceptional craftsmanship, use of cutting-edge materials, and unique, often futuristic, designs.
Here are some key points about Richard Mille:
Innovative Materials: Richard Mille watches often incorporate innovative materials such as carbon composites, titanium, ceramic, and sapphire crystal. These materials are chosen for their lightweight and durable properties, as well as their contribution to the brand's distinct aesthetic.
Technical Complexity: Richard Mille watches frequently feature complex and intricate movements, with a focus on performance and precision. The brand has developed numerous proprietary movements and complications.
Distinctive Design: Richard Mille watches are known for their bold and unconventional designs. The brand's timepieces often stand out with their sculptural cases, skeletonized dials, and three-dimensional constructions.
High-Profile Collaborations: Richard Mille has collaborated with various athletes, celebrities, and racing teams to create limited edition watches that reflect the personalities and interests of these individuals.
Extreme Sports and Motorsports: The brand's watches are often associated with high-performance activities such as motorsports, aviation, and extreme sports. Richard Mille watches are designed to withstand the rigors of demanding environments.
Limited Editions: Many Richard Mille watches are produced in limited quantities, contributing to their exclusivity and collectible status.
Luxury Pricing: Richard Mille watches are positioned at the top end of the luxury watch market and are known for their high price tags, reflecting the brand's emphasis on craftsmanship, innovation, and exclusivity.
Richard Mille's dedication to pushing the boundaries of watchmaking, its incorporation of innovative materials, and its distinctive design approach have established the brand as a symbol of modern luxury and technical excellence. The watches have gained a following among enthusiasts who appreciate the brand's fusion of advanced engineering and artistic creativity.

name: Roger Dubuis
description:
Roger Dubuis is a Swiss luxury watchmaker known for its distinctive and avant-garde designs, as well as its high-quality movements. The brand was founded in 1995 by Roger Dubuis and Carlos Dias in Geneva, Switzerland. Roger Dubuis watches are recognized for their combination of traditional watchmaking techniques with modern and innovative aesthetics.
Here are some key points about Roger Dubuis:
Geneva Seal: Roger Dubuis is known for achieving the prestigious 'Poinçon de Genève' (Geneva Seal) on many of its timepieces. This certification is awarded to watches that meet strict quality and finishing standards set by the Canton of Geneva.
Haute Horlogerie: The brand is known for its emphasis on haute horlogerie (high watchmaking), producing watches with complex movements, fine finishing, and intricate complications.
Excalibur Collection: The Excalibur collection is one of Roger Dubuis's most iconic lines. These watches often feature bold and contemporary designs with notable elements such as skeletonized dials and tourbillon movements.
Avant-Garde Aesthetics: Roger Dubuis watches are characterized by their avant-garde and modern designs. The brand often experiments with unconventional materials and architectural shapes.
Skeltonization: Many Roger Dubuis watches feature skeletonized dials and movements, allowing wearers to observe the inner workings of the timepiece.
Partnerships and Collaborations: The brand has collaborated with motorsports companies and participated in events such as the Lamborghini Super Trofeo racing series.
Limited Editions: Roger Dubuis frequently releases limited edition watches that showcase the brand's creativity and craftsmanship.
Swiss Craftsmanship: As a Swiss watch brand, Roger Dubuis emphasizes Swiss watchmaking traditions and craftsmanship.
Roger Dubuis's watches are often favored by those who appreciate bold design, technical complexity, and a fusion of artistic and engineering elements. The brand's commitment to pushing the boundaries of traditional watchmaking while adhering to high standards of quality has earned it a place among the esteemed luxury watchmakers of Switzerland.

name: Rolex
description:
Rolex is a Swiss luxury watch manufacturer renowned for its iconic and high-quality timepieces. The company was founded in 1905 by Hans Wilsdorf and Alfred Davis in London, England. However, Rolex's headquarters and manufacturing operations are based in Geneva, Switzerland, which is the heart of the Swiss watchmaking industry.
Here are some key points about Rolex:
Precision and Reliability: Rolex watches are known for their precision and reliability. The brand has been a pioneer in achieving chronometric accuracy and has played a significant role in advancing the standards of watch accuracy.
Oyster Case and Perpetual Movement: Rolex introduced the Oyster case in 1926, which was the world's first waterproof and dustproof watch case. Additionally, the brand's Perpetual movement, introduced in 1931, marked a milestone in automatic winding technology.
Iconic Models: Rolex has created several iconic watch models that have become synonymous with luxury and prestige. These include the Rolex Submariner, Rolex Datejust, Rolex Day-Date (often referred to as the 'President' watch), Rolex Daytona, and Rolex GMT-Master, among others.
Materials and Craftsmanship: Rolex is known for its meticulous attention to detail, use of high-quality materials such as 904L stainless steel and precious metals, and careful craftsmanship in each watch.
Resale Value: Rolex watches are often considered investment pieces due to their strong resale value and enduring popularity in the secondary market.
Rolex Crown Logo: The Rolex crown logo is recognized globally as a symbol of luxury and quality.
Rolex in Pop Culture: Rolex watches have appeared in numerous movies, TV shows, and cultural references, solidifying their status as cultural icons.
Exclusive Production: Rolex controls all aspects of its watch production, from design to manufacturing to quality control. The brand's watches are produced in relatively limited quantities, adding to their exclusivity.
Rolex's commitment to precision, reliability, and timeless design has established it as one of the most recognizable and esteemed luxury watch brands in the world. The brand's watches are sought after by collectors, enthusiasts, and individuals who value both horological excellence and iconic style.
